caseTitle: Tahir Sadiq v. Faisal Ali and others
authorJudge: Mr. Justice Syed Mansoor Ali Shah
tagline: (i) The right to form or be a member of a political party under Article 17(2) of our Constitution includes not only the right to contest elections but also the right to vote for the candidate of one’s choice. (ii) The courts, in their role as guardians of democracy and fundamental rights, should approach electoral matters with circumspection, ensuring that their interventions uphold the democratic principles upon which the nation thrives and the fundamental rights of citizens to contest elections and vote for the candidates of their choice. (iii) In the absence of any contrary provision in the Constitution or the Elections Act, the civil right of a person to contest an election is not abridged by his status of being a proclaimed offender in some criminal case.
